Description: Ostracon, large fragment of the shoulder-section of a light-brown pottery vessel, the interior is thickly encrusted with a yellow-brown resinous deposit, the exterior, ribbed in the lower section, is covered with a buff-coloured slip and remains of two lines of red-painted text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394426) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394426)
